snippet: The 5-to-4 decision by the Supreme Court could affect untold numbers of young immigrants across the country, including the children of New York City teachers.
abstract: Divided Supreme Court rules that children of immigrants who lost their places in slow-moving immigration system, because they turned 21 before their parents received their immigrant visa, cannot be given special priority and must start out anew on road to citizenship; decision could affect untold numbers of young immigrants across country.
lead_paragraph: The 5-to-4 decision by the Supreme Court could affect untold numbers of young immigrants across the country, including the children of New York City teachers.

headline.main: Children ‘Aged Out’ of Immigration System Won’t Get Special Priority, Justices Rule
headline.print_headline: Justices Rule in Key Case Affecting Immigrants
